thread.title: Malcolm Turnbull accuses Tony Abbott of sabotaging government amid poll slump
thread.title_full: Malcolm Turnbull accuses Tony Abbott of sabotaging government amid poll slump

author: Fergus Hunter
title: Malcolm Turnbull accuses Tony Abbott of sabotaging government amid poll slump
text:
No rate cut says RBA head No rate cut says RBA head 
All but ruling out rate cuts, Reserve Bank governor Philip Lowe defended corporate tax cuts in front of the House Standing Committee on Economics. More videos Libs rally around Turnbull after Abbott snipes 
An attempt by Tony Abbott to drag the Liberal Party to the political right has backfired as former Abbott loyalists broke ranks in disgust at comments they viewed as disloyal to the party and a flagrant attempt to visit revenge on Malcolm Turnbull. Vision courtesy ABC News 24. 
Mr Turnbull was direct in apportioning the blame on Monday: "A poll is a snapshot of opinion at one particular time. The election is two years away and what we saw was an outburst on Thursday and it had its desired impact on the Newspoll, it was exactly as predicted and calculated." 
The poll also showed falling satisfaction with Mr Turnbull's performance and a shrinking lead over Opposition Leader Bill Shorten as preferred prime minister. Forty per cent of people polled said Mr Turnbull would be a better prime minister compared to 33 per cent for Mr Shorten. Related Content
